alert.note: Alert for Caroline (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 11:40PM EDT until August 22 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Maryland...including the following county...Caroline. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Federalsburg, Preston, Agner, Smithville, and Harmony. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
